thread.title: The 5 people chuffed Wayne Rooney is staying at Man United... and the ONE person who's absolutely gutted
thread.title_full: The 5 people chuffed Wayne Rooney is staying at Man United... and the ONE person who's absolutely gutted

author: Jake Polden
title: The 5 people chuffed Wayne Rooney is staying at Man United... and the ONE person who's absolutely gutted
text:
Sport The 5 people chuffed Wayne Rooney is staying at Man United... and the ONE person who's absolutely gutted The Red Devils forward snubbed a move to China much to the delight of most, but not everyone... Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now A few people happy to see Wayne Rooney staying Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Wayne Rooney has confirmed he is staying at Manchester United - for the time being, at least - and will not be moving to the Chinese Super League. 
The news will split opinion, of course, although we think there are a number of reasons why you should celebrate his decision - 45 reasons to be precise. 
And it seems at least five people agree with us - five big names in the world of football who wax lyrical about the England forward in the above video. 
Everyone from his current boss Jose Mourinho to the national team boss Gareth Southgate and even the notoriously difficult to please Roy Keane will be very happy he is staying put. Wayne Rooney is staying put... for now at least (Photo: Reuters) 
However, one person isn't... well, there's always one isn't there. 
Below are the five people who will be chuffed with Rooney's decision to snub the Far East and the Red Devils fan who is pulling his hair out. Enjoy: Zlatan Ibrahimovic 
The big man himself will be pleased Rooney is staying in the UK. 
The Swedish striker called the 31-year-old a "fantastic" person in a recent interview. 
He then bettered his comment by referring to him as the "perfect player". Now a cynic could look at that at think it's pretty standard praise from someone in the world of football. The Swedish striker will be very pleased Rooney is staying in the Premier League (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
But think for a second. This is Ibrahimovic making these claims - a man who loves himself more than anything in the world AND even took credit for Henrikh Mkhitaryan's wondergoal. 
So it's a pretty big deal. Phil Neville 
The former Red Devils midfielder is another who will punch the air with joy at the news Rooney is to stay put in England. 
Neville strongly believes the striker has a lot left in the tank, and could easily break back into the Man United first team, should injuries continue to pile up at Old Trafford. 
"What I would say to him is 'stick it out at Manchester United'", Neville told BBC Radio 5 live. Phil Neville tips Rooney to feature in Man United's EFL Cup final on Sunday (Photo: John Peters) 
"At the moment, he's not in the team and has got a slight knock but Mkhitaryan has gone off injured tonight [Wednesday]. 
"You never know, he could come on in the final on Sunday and make a massive impact, score, and then finish the season so well." Roy Keane 
"Madness" is the way the Irishman described Rooney's proposed move to China, suggesting he would definitely like to see the forward stay in Manchester. 
Why? Well, according to the Red Devils legend, who spoke on ITV's Champions League Highlights show, there is plenty of life left in the 31-year-old. "There's plenty left yet for Wayne Rooney to do in Europe" (Photo: ITV) 
"He can still play football and still play at the top level in England, Germany, Spain, Italy. Madness," explained Keane. 
"Going to China? Madness. He's 31-years of age. There's plenty left yet for Wayne Rooney to do in Europe. I don't think he's short of money, is he?" Gareth Southgate 
It's always favourable to be in the good books of the manager of the England national team. 
And fortunately for Rooney, Gareth Southgate absolutely loves him - at least that's what we get from the above video - and will be very pleased he is staying in the UK. Gareth Southgate hailed Rooney's experience (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Speaking to the press, the England boss hailed the invaluable experience the United front man brings to the national team. 
Adding that when he gets into his rhythm he's actually pretty good... Jose Mourinho 
The Red Devils manager has had an up-and-down relationship with Rooney this season. 
He's opted to drop him for a number of games, and apparently considers other players to better options in attack for his squad. (Photo: Michael Regan) 
That said, he was clear when he told the press that should the 31-year-old decide to leave it will NOT be because he has been forced out of the club. 
It will be because Rooney wants a new challenge. So there, there you go, that's undeniable proof Mourinho absolutely LOVES the forward. A fan named Andrew 
The man, the myth, the legend and the ONE person who will be unhappy Rooney has decided to stay at Manchester United. 
Speaking on BBC Radio 5 Live shortly after the striker broke Sir Bobby Robson's record to become the club's all-time goal-scorer, Andrew well and truly slammed him. You can't please everyone (Photo: Action Images via Reuters / Jason Cairnduff) 
"It's time to get rid of Rooney, because he's a liability," explained Andrew. 
"Mourinho is a decent manager, he will do a decent job, but they need to get rid of Rooney now while they can still get money for him." Dear me. poll loading Is Rooney right to stay at Manchester United? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
